title: Riots response to my chat restriction ticket, and why I got punished. :)
body:
Posting again because image was unclear, sorry.

I've been chat restricted twice within about 3 days. I'm not a toxic person and I don't even play ranked. I got chat restricted for the most ridiculous reasons and I BARELY use any sensitive words such as swear words. This is actually a fucking joke.

Here's what Riot had to say about it.. lol

replies.body:
Wait.........

Your fucking with me right?

Day 43: Riot's bullshit still continues to flood the boards, everyday players are complaining and the absurdity of punishments only continues to rise. We can only pray that some day, Riot will listen. To everyone out there who has been punished or no longer has an account, godspeed to you all.

Lol one sided chat log is easy to say i'm the toxic person. Shen was my support and he was also saying things to me aswell as vayne that's why i said be quiet. And telling shen about their spells being on cd? That's strategy. I was using chat correctly though it may not have been polite. I was. Even though you've highlighted negative things its very minor as opposed to what they were saying and, you don't know what they were saying. But anyway, that's your opinion.

If i typed what you type, and i got ban for it. Ill accept it; Because that was toxic and sound like a little kid bit-ching over spilled milk.

The whole chat i havent read any strategy about the game, just on and on about how the other player failed you. REALLY? If someone else typed exactly what you yourself've typed. You would've report that person aswell, and you would  be glad he or she got banned. 

So why do you think your ban is unfair?
Because you're making a false accusation when evidence is right infront of you, you don't see me pull any race cards. LOL What's your problem?
You don't have to swear to be negative. You don't have to be racist to be negative. You don't have to use any particular set of words to be toxic.

What gets me is that even if you ARE toxic, it may be just a one time thing, but they treat you as a criminal if you are unlucky enough to be target reported. Honour should play a bigger part of the system.

You could say nothing in one game, but play well and be honoured, and be a racist asshole the very next. Should the honour make that behaviour ok? Should honour mean we aren't held accountable for our actions?

yeah it's bothering me that a report for something small contributes largely to your punishment.

While that's a very vague answer, I would recommend posting your chat logs if you are unsure what may have gotten you punished.

To give you a proper answer where support did not (assuming nothing was edited), someone else being toxic/negative does not give you a right to be, and there is still 3 other players on your team that have to sit there and hear it. If they are toxic, and you report them, then they will have their behaviour reviewed same as you, and will be considered for punishment same as you. If someone told you to kill yourself, they're likely facing an instant 14 day ban (one step from perma) where you only got a chat restriction for whatever you said. In other words you are held accountable for your actions, and they will be held accountable for theirs.

"Sensitive words" are only one means of being negative, and you can use most of those words in a completely casual manner. You could be ragging on your team the entire game and not use a single swear, but it's still negative behaviour. This is largely why I recommend posting your chat logs because there seems to be a common misconception that if you aren't swearing you aren't being negative.

To clarify some of what the support agent was trying to say (badly), you don't have to be a shining beacon of positivity, but you will be held responsible for negative behaviours, regardless of who started it. If you are struggling to reign in your negativity, then it's best to simply mute and move on, unbind chat if you have to, because fanning the flames doesn't help anyone, it does the exact opposite, and even if being a positive member of the community doesn't mean jack to you, if nothing else it puts you one step closer to losing your account.

A lot of people seem to be assuming the lines quoted were what the agent was presenting as evidence, but I'm pretty dang sure he was only giving an example of how not constructive you were being, not saying "this is what got you punished".

Obviously we here on boards don't have the luxury of quoting things that would have contributed to your punishment since we can't see your logs, which I why I recommend posting them if you want advice. If the ban was unwarranted then you have community support and fuel to appeal it, and if it was then we can supply you with a much clearer reason why, bearing in mind of course that we cannot see any in game factors that may have contributed.

>A lot of people seem to be assuming the lines quoted were what the agent was presenting as evidence, but I'm pretty dang sure he was only giving an example of how not constructive you were being, not saying "this is what got you punished".

I mean, it's a copy paste response with a bit of chat log put in there, you'd assume that they would use something more significant then what they have (again assuming that it's not tampered with)

And the reason the response is bad in general is because Copy Paste is always going to be terrible.

I mean, ti doesn't really sound like a copy paste response. Generic sure, but it sure sounds like they were directly responding, just not in the way OP wanted them to. Any copy paste response would be better written than that anyway. And frankly, if a copy paste response can address the issue in an effective manner, then what is the reason not to use them? Obviously with Player Behaviour things are a bit different, and this was a pretty crap response, but you seem to hate any and all copy past responses in general which I think is rather absurd.

The quote they used sounds like it was a direct response to where OP said "I continued to play and proceeded to win without negativity". In other words "typing blahblahblah a lot can't really be called continuing to play and winning without negativity".

>I mean, ti doesn't really sound like a copy paste response. Generic sure, but it sure sounds like they were directly responding

2nd paragraph is entirely a copy paste, 3rd definitely sounds like a copy paste, especially with the way it directs into the chat log (because of the wording, it just looks like it's meant to be directed at any generic chat log pull up, not the chat log in question.)

Giving the same information as someone else in the past doesn't mean it's a copy paste. Are you saying every science lesson ever is just a copy paste?

That third paragraph makes total sense to me looking at his logs. He talks way too much and it's pretty much all negative, to the point of typing out stuff as pointless and asinine as blahblahblahblah. Frankly I think it's an excellent example of how not to use chat.

When someone calls you bad and comments on your k/d all the time during a game while you're still trying especially tilted yes, I'm pretty sure a lot of people would like to see them punished. it was a losing game and it was unlikely that we'd win, I was constantly getting killed and it was out of my hand. I'd rather entertain myself talking to this fuckwit who has so much to say about me when they don't know me but can only base their comments on my k/d. I'm still failing to understand, especially on that second game. If you imagine an xp bar, but instead a punishment xp bar and when it reaches its max, you get punished. I wouldn't care if it added points to that, But to actually get penalised for it, That's what I'm not happy about. The first game, I only agree I am guilty of telling shen to do something because he just basically didn't do anything to help me, who wouldn't get frustrated about that. The second game is just horse shit, nothing worth getting penalised for.

If they've already said those things then they're already open to punishments. What is the point in opening yourself up as well other than to aggravate them? Everyone gets tilted, not everyone abuses their team for the next 20+ minutes as a result.

To use your analogy, your first game almost filled up the bar, and the second along with your recent negative history was enough to fill up those last few points.

You think the only thing you did wrong in that first game is what you said to Shen at the start? You need to take a good hard look at your behaviour then. If your response to someone irl saying something you disagreed with was "blahblahblahblahblah" then at best they're going to walk away and discredit anything you might have to say as the asinine rambling of a small child.

Using their own behaviour against them just makes you as bad as they are. If you're okay with that, then fine, but it means you also accept the same responsibility and the same consequences for that choice. If you're fine with stopping to their level then that's up to you, but you can't be surprised when both parties get punished, because in your own words you believed they should be.

The most negative thing I say is I'm reporting them lol

If you were punished then either it's a false positive, in which case the appeal would have held water, or you said something much worse than "I'm reporting them lol". You don't get punished just for saying you are reporting someone, even if it is often bad form, it's not strictly toxic on it's own.

>in which case the appeal would have held water

Ummmm, no because riot support don't actually look at whether the report was deserved (Luna being a recent example of this, having had hers overturned by Gehirn ON THE BOARDS)

Overturned because he disagreed with the support agents decision not because it wasn't reviewed. It was an edge and unusual case. If it wasn't then why wouldn't it happen more? Why wouldn't Gehirn be revoking or reducing the bans of everyone who comes to bitch on boards about how they "couldn't possible have done anything worthy of punishment" despite the fact that they know exactly what they did. He obviously has the power to do so, and the time to look at at least some of them.

One example does not an argument make.
It wasn't even an edge case.

Okay, I really am having a hard time wrapping my head around your logic, you seem like a riot apologist but that's fine. What i'm super confused about with this ban is how you can have a heated discussion with very minimal swearing if any at all and really no direct abuse towards any player and to end up with a 25 chat ban restriction even if he had been punished before, (which can be debated if that one was even justified)  you realize the next is a 14 day ban right?  This Rioter claims he has gone through this guys account and the best he can come up for an example for his ban is blahahahah? honestly if that's the case god knows what happens when you get a 10 game chat ban? Do you say good job with a smiley face and get one of those? and yes i'm aware the argument is that he isn't using chat very constructively which is fair enough its a bit of spam. great.....  you also say its entirely possible that it wasn't just this game but a few bad games leading up to this that caused the chat ban. Riot usually tell you if that's the case or not. 

 I personally believe if riot thinks that someone is not using chat in game correctly, that they should warn them in game that their chat isn't being constructive, a warning in lobby to remember to be constructive in chat or face a ban, or to simply time them out for 3-5 mins at a time in game when the chat isn't being particularly useful.  yes of course ban someone when they are straight up being toxic with swear words and constant abuse in chat but the logs he posted he just seemed frustrated with his team mates, clearly he wanted to win.  I recently read riot took away warnings due to community feedback and now instead op for straight up bans.. This is a silly mistake. Most people who get a warning would probably get shit scared and stop.. People spend hundreds of hours if not thousands and definitely thousands of dollars on their accounts  and a warning to a person who may of just slipped up one game seems reasonable to me. I'm all for cleaning up the community in regards to toxic players but it seems to be you literally cant say anything unless it is G rated or you may face a ban, if this is the case why do we have to option to have no filter on our chats...

I personally think league players don't give a shit about chat unless its particularly disgusting, (such as constant spam swearing, racism, sexism, and inting.  if people are having a heated discussion in game without it being just a complete flame fest and no one is actually talking about the game just comments like "you're fucking bad" "l2p" "lmao this guy is terrible" in all chat etc.  Those are the kind of things that deserve a chat ban maybe even a 14 day ban with it continuing it should be a perm.  Yes the things he typed were not ideal but to be one step away from a 14 day ban is just dumb.  I mean there are some things in the chat that should be good for example "could have helped you but i'm lagging, sorry bro" and report Jax for suicide.  in none of these chats is he just going off on someone. 


So yeah, i honestly think for cases like these warnings should be issued, and if a warning happens and they do something like this again, yeah ban the fuck out of them.  But i feel like riot should just get rid of chat and use pings if this is the threshhold for bans. :)
